solution_line_template: The class was divided into {boys_ratio_part} + {girls_ratio_part} = <<{boys_ratio_part}+{girls_ratio_part}={total_ratio_parts}>>{total_ratio_parts} parts.
So each part is equal to {total_students}/{total_ratio_parts} = <<{total_students}/{total_ratio_parts}={students_per_part}>>{students_per_part} students.
Since there are {boys_ratio_part} parts for boys, then there are {students_per_part} x {boys_ratio_part} = <<{boys_ratio_part}*{students_per_part}={num_boys}>>{num_boys} boys in class.
So there are {total_students} - {num_boys} = <<{total_students}-{num_boys}={num_girls}>>{num_girls} girls in class.
Hence, there are {num_boys} - {num_girls} = <<{num_boys}-{num_girls}={more_boys_than_girls}>>{more_boys_than_girls} boys more than girls.
